awd_titl_txt: Hierarchical Test Generation and Design For Testability of  Core-Based Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This research is on hierarchical and symbolic test  generation and design for testability techniques for core-  based systems. The system can be a combination of soft, firm  and hard cores. In the case of untestable soft cores,  hierarchical testability techniques are being applied to  make them testable. Also techniques of adding hardware so  the cores are functionally transparent and can propagate  test data without information loss are being developed. The  approach is to integrate testable and transparent cores to  ensure justification of precomputed test sequences. This  test generation approach is independent of the bit-width of  the cores. The case of firm and hard cores which have  testability features built into them by core providers is  also being explored. Approaches here include: using  information supplied by the core vendor; use of in-built  testability features; and providing transparency through  glue logic outside the core.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
